alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 09 at 9:51AM CDT until May 09 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN NORTON AND SOUTHEASTERN DECATUR COUNTIES... At 950 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Clayton, or 17 miles southwest of Norton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported 65 mph wind gusts near Norton. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Lenora and Edmond. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
